intro: Maoutia australis, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its tall, narrow leaves that can grow up to 3 meters in length. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers that are clustered in panicles. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and riverine environments. Maoutia australis has been used by Māori for centuries to make baskets, mats, and other woven items.
